intro: Loxanthera corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered sandplain lilly, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
